channel.title: Desperate Port Forwarding Help
channel.description:
Hey guys, so I am in dire need of help. I recently got a new ISP and my old one was automatically port forwarded, but this ones makes me port forward. Now I've tried so many times. But I do not believe it is POSSIBLE to port forward on my ISP. Here is what it looks like in the Admin page thing.
This is the Port Forwarding page.
[img]http://oi44.tinypic.com/90nlo1.jpg[/img]
And this is something called the Port Filtering page.
[img]http://oi42.tinypic.com/o0nywz.jpg[/img]
Can anybody help me out? I have no idea what to do.

item.title: Desperate Port Forwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

If it’s not on portward.com I think it may not be able too.

Like I said in your other post in server help.
Ring up your Internet provider, ask them for assistance, they may be able to help you with the problem. If they can’t help you, you might be able to make a request for a new router

Read full topic

item.title: Desperate Port Forwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Yeah it’s not on portforward.com, but how can I make sure my firewall isn’t blocking the port?

Read full topic

item.title: Desperate Port Forwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Check out portforward.com you may of just missed something.

Also, check that your firewalls aren’t blocking port 43594

Read full topic
